Class Purse

  • java.lang.Object
    • Purse

  • public class Purse
extends java.lang.Object
    A purse holds a collection of coins.CPSC 1181 Lab III from Programming Exercise P7.5 Big Java, 4th Edition, Cay Horstmann
    Author:
    modified heavily by Gladys Monagan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Purse()
      Constructs an empty purse.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Purse

        public Purse()
        Constructs an empty purse.

    • Method Detail

      • addCoin

        public void addCoin(Coin coin)
        Adds a coin to the purse regardless of whether the coin was in the purse already or not
        Parameters:
        coin - the coin to add

      • removeCoin

        public boolean removeCoin(Coin coin)
        Removes a coin from the purse that is the same (denomination) as coin i.e. it removes a coin from the pruse that is equal to coin.

        precondition: equals has been define for coin

        Parameters:
        coin - a coin that matches the one that should be removed from purse
        Returns:
        true if the matching coin was removed from the purse, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gives a text representation of the purse.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string in the format "Purse[coin1,coin2,...]"

      • occurrences

        public int occurrences(Coin coin)
        Counts the number of occurrences of coin in this purse.

        IMPLEMENTATION detail for the lab: in order for two coins to be considered equal, their value and their name must match but there is a method equals defined inside of the Coin class already

        Parameters:
        coin - the item to match against
        Returns:
        count the number of times the coin is in purse

      • hasSameCoins

        public boolean hasSameCoins(Purse otherPurse)
        Determines if a purse has the same coins as the otherPurse, (regardless of order and possible duplicates).

        IMPLEMENTATION detail for the lab: you must use the method this.occurrences when implementing hasSameCoins

        Parameters:
        otherPurse - the other purse with coins
        Returns:
        true if this and the otherPurse have the same coins, false otherwise

      • hasSameCoinsOtherVersion

        public boolean hasSameCoinsOtherVersion(Purse otherPurse)
        Determines if a purse has the same coins as the otherPurse, (regardless of order and possible duplicates).

        IMPLEMENTATION detail for the lab: hasSameCoinsOtherVersion does not use the method this.occurrences

        Parameters:
        otherPurse - the other purse with coins
        Returns:
        true if this and the otherPurse have the same coins, false otherwise

      • getHighestCoinValue

        public int getHighestCoinValue()
        Gives the highest monetary value of any coin in the purse.
        Returns:
        the highest coin value of any coin in the purse and 0 if the purse is empty.
